answers.author: Laurence Bergman
answers.text:
Some organizations have work order / asset management software that public wprks, utilities, water plants, etc. use to document things like warranty information and dates, or reminders that certain valve needs to be inspected every 30 days, or that a filter is due to be replaced after so many hours of service.  IF you have such software, that might be a tool to use for the lease dates.  Outlook might work and you could create a shared calendar separate from your personal work ones.

answers.author: Jay Evans
answers.text:
If you have software that handles agenda management, check to see if it has functionality that will do what you want.  We needed to track contracts better and discovered our existing software had that capability.  The nice part about having it as part of the agenda management system is the avoidance of redundant data entry.  Since every lease or similar agreement must be approved by the Commission anyway, you just set an expiration date some period if time (say 120 days) ahead of the actual contract expiration and it will email the employee responsible.

author: Jamie Gwynn
text:
My township has a ton of land leases and cell tower leases that have terms and rents and deadlines for renewals.
Does anyone know of a solution to track all this data and have an alert sent to respective employees?  I'm trying not to do this in Outlook unless it's a last resort.
Thank you.
title: App to Remind of Lease Renewals?
